body.p: A presbyter and bishop in Rome who wrote a letter to the church at Corinth (AD 96), probably the earliest Christian writing outside the NT. Dionysius of Corinth (AD 170) was the first to name Clement as the author of that letter. Origen, an Alexandrian theologian, and Eusebius, the first church historian, identified the writer as the Clement listed in the Shepherd of Hermas, a Christian writing from the mid-second century.
